sub_title: FinTech | Banking | Financial Institution | KYC | CDD | COB | ODD | AML | CFT | Wwft | Transaction Monitoring | Risk Analysis | Account Management | Customer Service | Ms Office Suite | Core Banking | CAMLS pursuing
summary:
How will you define to make business success?
What does challenge mean to you?
How about learning?

To me, business success is business compliance and sustainability. Being a KYC officer, I am the gate keeper of our bank to prevent it from being used by financial crimes, to ensure it satisfies with the regulatory and compliance requirements, and to help it to appear more trustworthy to potential new customer, to understand customer’s profile, to serve the customer better and manage its risks prudently.

Keeping self-challenge is never easy but it makes me become a better version of myself. After nine years of working as a contract and commercial manager in the telecommunication sector, I changed my career to banking industry and became a KYC officer. It was proved by fact that I had made a right decision.

I believe in never stop learning. It is my way to explore and experience the world, spiritually and physically. So to me, learning is not just about courses, training and reading. It is also about to know and understand different people, to travel and discover a new city, and to take in different cultures. All those ways helped me to become who am I and to the “Me” I like.

If you are interested to have a talk to me, feel free to DM me via Linkdin or send me an email: J.WONG5518@gmail.com🍀

awards.title: Excellent Employee
awards.description: For outstanding performance and last contribution
awards.issuer: WEU Contrcat  Commercial & Fulfillment Management Dept.

profile_positions.description:
•	Routinely research for Industrial KYC services up to +/- 4 new cases per month to keep internal KYC procedure up-to-date with the latest legislation, new methods, procedures and technologies for AML/CFT. The BOC KYC service keeps in the lead of industrial practice.
•	Design and improve 2-4 policies and procedures of BOC KYC every year to strengthen daily execution & operation and create more effective AML compliance. The operation of each procedure has been increased +/- 10%.
•	Identify and investigate if any Money Laundering or Terrorist Financing cautionary flags to control suspicious activities and ensure full compliance for +/- 40 corporate customers.
•	Ensure +/- 10 new corporate customers are effectively on boarded per year to expand BOC customer portfolio. All new corporate customer portfolios are 100% complaint with legislation and regulations as well as Bank of China’s internal processes.
•	Provide daily advisory as primary contact to customer to truly understand customer needs, provide optimum service and improve customer engagement whilst remaining compliant.
•	Mentor (junior) team member daily and review his output ensure quality of work; ensure the team to meet the requirement of the efficiency as well as compliance.
profile_positions.title: KYC Officer

profile_positions.location: Den Haag, North Brabant Province, Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
•	Engagement in key customer
o	Led the commercial & contract negotiation team (4 FTE) and negotiated sales contracts with customer, ensure the success of the negotiation and business.
o	Designed the business model, worked together with cross-functional teams, including Product & Service, Legal, and Finance etc. to meet customer's needs as well as keep company's best interest.
o	Successfully signed the contracts of corporate level projects with contract amount more than XX M EUR.
•	Led the “Managed Contract Execution” process
o	 Managed contract process, responsible for the process improvements to ensure the effectiveness and efficiency.
o	  Improved the days sales outstanding (DSO) by 10 days and inventory turnover outstanding (ITO) by 15 days.
o	Reduced the average purchase order process period from 6 days to 2 days in 2017.
o	Awarded for the excellent team for payment terms management in 2018.
•	Managed the “Manage Authorization Execution” process
o	 Regulated and optimized the Authorization Execution process.
o	The management maturity of the decision making team ranked TOP3 in WEU region every year. 
o	Provided comprehensive suggestion based on the strategy, finance and risk to support C- level management to make decisions for biding and sales contract in a more efficient and effective manner.
o	Analysed the projects P&L of bid projects & sales contracts and monthly reported to CEO and management team, improve the efficiency & effectiveness and ensure the balance of the project profit and risk.
•	Team Management of 4 FTE: 
o	The department KPI ranked TOP 3 among the 9 representative offices in WEU region every year.
o	Responsible for team operation and management
o	Set the department annual KPI aligning with the corporate strategy, managed the Personal Performance of the team members
o	Provided mentoring, advise and support team members to make sure the timely accomplishment of the project and to improve the individual and team capability
profile_positions.title: Director of Contract and Commercial Dept.

profile_positions.description:
•	ensured a price-effective but commercially healthy solution through analysing and calculating project P&L based on company delegation
•	Looked for alternative and innovative solutions where appropriate by leading the SOC response to commercial and financial requirements of (incl. but not limited to general terms and conditions) in the tender documents. .
•	Ensured the proposals and contract are realistic, risk-balanced and fit for win-win purposes
•	Participated in and successfully complete implementing LTC (lead to cash) process and tooling to the 9 representative offices in WEU region by providing training and operation support.
•	Designed case studies and provided training to 100+ employees/year in commercial excellence and best practices sharing
profile_positions.title: Commercial Manager
